physical_examinations.vital_signs: Blood pressure: 110/60 mmHg; ACTH: 494.35 pmol/liter; 17-hydroxyprogesterone: 8.47 nmol/liter; cortisol levels: below detection limit.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Female patient with ambiguous external genitalia (Prader genital stage III) at age of 14 years; no clinical evidence for hypertension; ultrasound and x-ray examinations showed Mullerian structures and normal adrenals.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Bone age: 8 years at 4 years chronological age.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Male patient presented with obesity, no hyperpigmentation, Tanner stages P1 and G3, testicular volume of 1 ml.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially presented with normal genitalia at birth, showed genital and scrotal hyperplasia at age of 2.5 years, and thereafter developed obesity and precocious sexual development.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Blood pressure: 110/60 mmHg; testosterone: 2.90 nmol/liter; androstenedione: 26.62 nmol/liter.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Female with clitoral hyperplasia categorized as Prader genital stage II; bone age acceleration of 3.5 years diagnosed at age 3.6 years.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Shows progression of virilization signs and accelerated bone age.
